Abstract: The DARPA Subterranean Challenge has catalyzed advancements in field robotics, focusing on resilient systems capable of navigating complex underground environments. This paper analyzes the technological innovations and strategic approaches employed by participating teams. Emphasizing autonomous exploration, mapping, and communication in GPS-denied settings, the challenge has driven significant progress in robotic perception and decision-making. Insights from this competition highlight the potential for deploying robust robotic solutions in real-world subterranean applications, underscoring the importance of interdisciplinary collaboration in overcoming the unique challenges posed by these environments.
